    • Method Detail

      • getDrawProbability

        public static double getDrawProbability(int n1,
                        int n2,
                        double beta,
                        double drawMargin)
        Calculates the probability of a draw between two teams, given the amount of players in both teams. The formula is taken from page 6 of the TrueSkill technical report (MSR-TR-2006-80).

        Formula: \(Draw Probability = 2\Phi \left ( \frac{\varepsilon }{\sqrt(n_1 + n_2)\beta } \right ) - 1\)

        Parameters:
        n1 - Number of players on team 1
        n2 - Number of players on team 2
        beta - The performance variance used. Normally should be (DEFAULT_MEAN)/6.
        drawMargin - The drawMargin for the game
        Returns:
        The probability of a draw occuring

      • getDrawMargin

        public static double getDrawMargin(int n1,
                   int n2,
                   double beta,
                   double drawProbability)
        Calculates the draw margin for a game given the probability of a draw between two teams. The formula is derived from the one on page 6 of the TrueSkill technical report (MSR-TR-2006-80).

        Original formula: \(Draw Probability = 2\Phi \left ( \frac{\varepsilon }{\sqrt(n_1 + n_2)\beta } \right ) - 1\)
        Derived formula: \(\varepsilon = \Phi^{-1} \left ( \frac{Draw Probability + 1}{2} \right ) \sqrt(n_1 + n_2)\beta\)

        Parameters:
        n1 - Number of players on team 1
        n2 - Number of players on team 2
        beta - The performance variance used. Normally should be (DEFAULT_MEAN)/6.
        drawProbability - The probability of a draw occuring
        Returns:
        The drawMargin for the game

      • functionV

        public static double functionV(double deltaMean,
               double drawMargin,
               double c,
               boolean draw)
        Helper method for functionV
        Parameters:
        c - The amount deltaMean and drawMargin have to be divided by.

      • functionV

        public static double functionV(double deltaMean,
               double drawMargin,
               boolean draw)
        The v function as described in the TrueSkill technical report (MSR-TR-2006-80) at page 4.

        The formula when the game was not a draw: $$\frac{\mathcal{N}(t - \varepsilon)}{\Phi(t - \varepsilon)}$$

        The formula when the game was a draw: $$\frac{\mathcal{N}(- \varepsilon - t ) - \mathcal{N}(\varepsilon - t )} {\Phi(\varepsilon - t) - \Phi(- \varepsilon - t)}$$

        Parameters:
        deltaMean - The difference in mean between the winner and the loser. (μWinner - μloser)
        drawMargin - The draw margin for the game
        draw - Whether the game was a draw
        Returns:
        The additive and multiplicative correction term for the mean

      • functionW

        public static double functionW(double deltaMean,
               double drawMargin,

               boolean draw)

        Parameters:

        The formula when the game was not a draw: $$$$

        The formula when the game was a draw: $$$$

        Parameters:

        drawMargin - The draw margin for the game
        draw - Whether the game was a draw
        Returns:
        The additive and multiplicative correction term for the variance
